page.title: 19Studfold Farm,Kirkby
page.content: At the centre of our Domesday block lies Studfold Farm,one of a partnership of three farms run by the Sowter family. Most of the local land once belonged to the Duke of Portland.Studfold Farm has been established for about 150 years,and the Sowter family have worked it since 1952. It covers sandy soil,clay, limestone and clay again nearer Bentinck Colliery. Two farms in the area have dairy herds and most others carry some livestock. Studfold has 40 fat cattle,6 milking cows,a few sheep,4 geese,and fowls for eggs.It has 40 acres of wheat for bread flour and stock feed;60 acres of barley for beer,whiskey and feed;50 acres of grass for hay for cattle and horses;30 acres of potatoes,5 acres of cabbages and 60 acres of oil seed rape
